message: ok
so, over a year has passed since the last event listed on djangoevents.com
i'm unpredictable
so not only is it a bit of a pain, it's limited to administrators
yeah? i didn't expect you to heed the call :)
(nothing wrong with that, just didn't expect it)
opening it up for public submissions should greatly improve the usefulness of the site
yeah, for the site itself i have my own svn repo but it isn't hosted anywhere interesting
i guess so
that's what powers it, and there are some features to be added that would make the site a lot easier to deal with
i can see about adding you to that though and you can migrate it to github if you want
but thanks for the interest! hopefully it can be interesting once again
i clearly don't have the time or motivation to continue developing it or maintaining the database, so is anyone else interested in taking the reigns?
er, @jdunck dang it
looks simple enough
unless you have a new repo for the site
I think it can with some TLC
mostly it's just templates
either way, i can't look at it until tonight
@jducnk since you mentioned geodjango in regards to djangopeople.net, would you consider looking at dregni and see if it would make sense to help greg integrate it with djangoevents.com as well?
looking at it now
ok. however you want to work it :)
I may take it over if you want to relieve yourself
or you can push it to gc and add me and i'll mirror it to my github
sure
that's fine. just ping me when you're done
take a look at dregni (http://code.google.com/p/dregni/) if you haven't already and see if the code there makes any sense
for one, there's no form for entering events, it's all done through the admin at the moment
i'll see about putting the remainder of the site code on github, but it's a pretty thin wrapper around dregni
ok. let me know when you have it on github
yeah. it would and would be easy to implement
Thanks for doing this, Marty.
@jdunck it's something i've considered for a long time, but i kept thinking i'd get back around to it
i guess moving to LA makes me want a fresh start on a lot of things :)
it'd require a good amount of manual work migrating the existing location-specific events, but most of them have addresses that should be easily geocoded
well yeah :)
Maybe after he migrates to github so I can do the work in a branch easily? :-)
i just wanted to see if you were willing first
